name: Masabi
slogan: Ticketing for Smarter Cities - SaaS Ticketing for Public Transit
description:
At Masabi we believe a new ticketing system using a mobile phone, contactless bank card or smartcard should be available to every passenger and to every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive cost or taking years to deliver, helping passengers move seamlessly from A to B.

Our solutions have been deployed and are operational in cities around the globe, including; Boston, London, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, New York, New Orleans, Athens, across the United Kingdom, France, Sydney and beyond.

Our cloud-based, multi-format platform, Justride, facilitates the use of a variety of fare media including mobile tickets, contactless credit cards, smartcard, paper barcode and more. Once deployed, other transportation and best-of-breed can be added; building a MaaS (Mobility-as-a-Service) offering with the public transit agency at its core. Tickets can be sold via branded apps, web portals or SDKs integrated into 3rd party services; all linked together through the Justride back office.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.description:
Who are we?
 
At Masabi we believe a new ticketing system using a mobile phone, contactless bank card or smartcard should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive cost or taking years to deliver, helping passengers move seamlessly from A to B. With deployments to over 40 transit agencies across 4 continents, Masabi’s team has been delivering innovation to millions of riders of public transportation for over ten years.
 
We recently announced key partnerships utilizing our Software Development Kit to integrate public transit ticketing with rideshare (Uber) and journey planning (Transit) applications.
 
Come join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

The role...
 
We are looking for a Front-End Javascript developer with experience in core web technologies (Javascript, HTML5, CSS) to work as part of our highly successful Justride team.
The Justride team are responsible for the development of a hybrid mobile web app and web application. These platforms combined currently process over $1 billion transactions a year. With these kinds of numbers, security and fraud mitigation are paramount to our success.
We ensure high standards by comprehensive end to end and unit testing, as well as refactoring to ensuring we work to the latest standards, best practices and we are in the process of upgrading some of our frameworks such as Angular to the latest version.

We work as part of a cross-discipline team who deliver robust and reusable components originating from product requirements through UX, design, development, and quality assurance. We are looking for a proactive person to join the team and actively contribute to code reviews, pairing, knowledge sharing, mentoring and technical roadmapping.





Technologies we’re using:
Angular 7 (NgRx, RxJS, TypeScript, SCSS)
Ionic 1 (in the process of migrating, mostly written in modern Angular style with ES6 classes and TypeScript)
Jasmine / Karma / Protractor
Git / Jira / Bamboo


Great if you have…
Experience with responsive CSS, HTML5 across multiple browsers and devices.
Significant working experience with – and a desire to work using – agile methodologies (e.g. Kanban, XP, Scrum, Continuous Delivery).
Working experience with automated testing (e.g. TDD/BDD & related tools).
Experience working in a mobile environment.
Experience in using and setting up automated build infrastructure (e.g. Bamboo with AWS).
Experience building hybrid mobile apps (e.g. Cordova / Ionic).
Experience with iOS & Android development (Java / Objective C) for Cordova plugins.
Experience in migrating from Angular 1.


 
Masabi is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. 
 
 
﻿Benefits:
Competitive salary package
Bright spacious office in quiet area in Old Street with floor to ceiling windows and garden
Pension scheme
Childcare vouchers
Unlimited snacks and drinks, with regular free lunches
Flexible working hours and up to 30 days holiday per year
Cycle to work scheme
Regular social gatherings with monthly allowance for each employee
Onsite yoga classes
Biannual company events
Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
Who we are

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit, by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company, developing a fare collection and ticketing platform that allows commuters to buy and present tickets for public transport on their mobile phones or simply by tapping a bank card to travel. 

Defining the future of transport ticketing, Masabi launched integrations with Uber, and a journey planner called Transit, allowing users to purchase tickets for public transport right within those apps.

Justride is deployed in cities around the globe, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, The Hague, Los Angeles and many more with an exciting industry-first SDK deployment with Uber in Denver enabling the purchase of public transport tickets right within the Uber application.

We are about 115 people headquartered in London with offices in New York, Boston, and Cluj.


The Design Team

The Design Team is integral to the development of products at Masabi, whether that’s designing on-trend pixel perfect interfaces for our latest mobile app and web portals, or defining the experience of scanning your barcode at a ticket gate. We’re passionate about quality, open to exploring new ideas, and pragmatic about delivering the most effective outcomes. We work closely with the development teams to turn ideas and concepts into reality in an agile environment.


The Role

Working on our Justride platform, you will be designing seamless interactions and beautiful interface designs that will make life easier for millions of transport users across the globe. You will have the opportunity to help define and shape the look and feel of the entire Justride product: from concept and prototyping to delivering the finished article. You’ll work in a talented, multi-disciplinary team of product, engineering, and UX to ensure we’re meeting our own high standards and delivering meaningful value for our users.

 
We’re looking for a mid-level Product/UI Designer who can...

Always start with “Why?” 
Use a user-centered approach to solve problems – what is the use case and what are we trying to solve here? 
Think about the whole product experience, not just your piece of the puzzle.
Design collaboratively, across product, engineering, and management teams to ensure that all of the company's deliverables are at the highest possible quality.
Turn complicated, abstract problems into simple, elegant solutions from end to end. Owning early discovery planning into wireframes and high fidelity mockups.
Proactively pitch new ideas for how we can better the look and feel of our product range, making sure we’re at the forefront of the latest design trends.
Contribute to the evolution and maintenance of our brand assets, style guidelines, and contributing design components to our Design System.
Isn’t be afraid to fail, learn from it.


You will have the following...

A strong portfolio with examples of UI design, prototyping, wireframes, illustration and iconography in products you have delivered to market.
Strong knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Xd. (you can use any tools to get the job done, but we’re loving Figma at the moment!)
A passion for UI/UX, awareness of the latest industry trends and mobile UI patterns.
A proven track record of using current best practices to inform design decisions.
Experience working alongside product managers and developers in an agile environment to deliver products to market.
Excitement for joining a fast-paced environment full of people that like to celebrate success regularly.
 

 
Benefits:

Competitive salary package
Flexible working hours and up to 30 days holiday per year (not including bank holidays)
Pension scheme
Onsite yoga classes
Childcare vouchers
Cycle to work scheme
Unlimited snacks and drinks, with regular free lunches
Regular social gatherings with monthly allowance for each employee
Biannual company events
Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world
 

Masabi is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. 

You can apply directly on: https://www.comeet.co/jobs/masabi/72.00E/product-designer-contract-or-perm/28.21F
